page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The survey area covers parts of {Winston and Gainford parishes.} The general land elevation is{100-150m with a SE aspect, the main drainage being Alwent Beck and Westholme Beck both tributaries of the R. Tees. The area is mostly deciduous woods and enclosed open land used for permanent pasture, arable crops and intensive grassland. The area is crossed E/W by the{A67 and N/S by the{B6274}plus many minor roads and tracks linking the main settlement{Winston}to the hamlets South Cleatlam, Little Newsham and Winston Station. The A67 links the area to the larger market towns of {Barnard Castle}and{Darlington,}5 and 10 miles away respectively.
